properties.name: Aboyne Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The Archie Foundation is the official charity of the Royal Aberdeen Children\'s Hospital. This fantastic charities aim is \'making the difference\' for children who are patients of the NHS in Grampian and the islands. Nomad have been appointed to produce artworks for Aboyne Hospital Accident and Emergency and GMED Department

properties.name: Angel
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Commerce and Industry 1889, James Alexander Ewing, on top of the Angel building by Bruce and Hey.

properties.name: Arts & Social Sciences Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The first of two live projects undertaken at University of Bristol. The Arts and Social Sciences Building was completed in 1970 and had fallen behind in providing the best facilities for today\'s learners. The space had become dark and dingy with offices clustered around windows and pc\'s etc added in wherever possible. We removed the offices creating a brighter space, created a range of learning spaces and support structures and added some much needed colour.

properties.name: Bar 10
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Glasgow\'s best style bar, Bar 10 designed by Ben Kelly. The List, Glasgow\'s guide to leisure actually describes the decor as \'a little tired\' How dare they!

properties.name: Bar Ten
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc A design classic by Ben Kelly. Nostalgic Nomad coffee/gossip spot.

properties.name: Barrowlands
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Iconic Glasgow landmark and world famous concert venue. Originally built in 1934, bombed then rebuilt in 1960 yet sadly historic Scotland have refused to protect the building and iconic sign. See link above for more info.

properties.name: Battlefield Rest
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Studio favorite. Great Italian food.

properties.name: Big Bertha
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The Finnieston Crane, or Big Bertha as she is known to locals. One of the most poignant reminders of Glasgow\'s majestic shipbuilding past. (photo courtesy of Midge McKay\'s photostream - Flickr)

properties.name: Botanic Gardens Railway Station
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The Station was built in 1896 and closed in 1939. Although the station itself was on the ground level the platforms are underground, beneath the Botanic Gardens. (pictures courtesy of MaZe and Thomas Nugent)

properties.name: Botanics Garage
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Built in 1912 this is the oldest surviving custom built garage in Glasgow. Sadly owners Arnold Clark want to pull it down to build flats, locals have mounted a campaign to try to stop this.

properties.name: Botanics Garage
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Built in 1912 this is the oldest surviving custom built garage in Glasgow. Sadly owners Arnold Clark want to pull it down to build flats, locals have mounted a campaign to try to stop this

properties.name: Bristol Airport
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Another home from home.

properties.name: Bristol City Museum & Art Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Provided much needed inspiration over the last two years and gave us somewhere to get a bit of culture between meetings. Although we didn\'t get into the Banksy exhibition. :(

properties.name: Britannia Panoptican Music Hall
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The oldest surviving music hall in the UK, if not the world. Founded in1856, the Panoptican was also the venue for the debut performance of 16 year old Stan Laurel in1906.

properties.name: Britannia Panoptican Music Hall
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The oldest surviving music hall in the UK, if not the world. Founded in1856, the Panoptican was also the venue for the debut performance of 16 year old Stan Laurel in1906.

properties.name: Browns
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc A frequent evening coffee spot.

properties.name: Caledonia Road Church
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Sadly abandoned Greek Thomson designed church, every inch covered in beautiful masonry details. Now slowly becoming submerged from within with greenery.

properties.name: Cardross College
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc St Peters Seminary or Cardross College. A Listed masterpiece by architects Gillespie Kidd and Coia complete in 1966. (photo courtesy Andy Haslam via oube)

properties.name: Chemistry
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad are currently working on proposals for the Chemistry Library and a series of connecting spaces which surrounds this. Over the years these students have adopted these spaces as both social spaces and group working spaces. Nomad spent 2 days on site, mapping journey\'s and favorite places, observing and interacting with students to gain insights into spatial requirements.

properties.name: Christ Died for our Sins
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Delightfully pink neon sign in Victoria Road. Been there since most of us were kids and a strong landmark on the South Side. We are not 100% sure but believe it belongs to Victoria Evangelical Church. Recently re-tubed though so somebody loves it.

properties.name: Citizens Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Fab productions for young and old, traditional and avant garde

properties.name: Classroom of the Future
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad are designing a classroom of the future for Blackpool and the Fylde College. We ran workshops with the staff in November and December 08 to help them to generate their ideas for the space. The design is a direct collaboration between the staff at BFC and our designers.

properties.name: DMOD
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc DMOD Dublin - We have recently entered into a design competition with this Dublin based architectural practice. Fingers crossed

properties.name: Dispatchwork Amsterdam
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc We just like this.

properties.name: Dublin City University
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Our clients at DCU were keen to create a learning environment with a difference and had identified the need for recreation and the need to family contact among the overseas students. The DCU learning cafe provides a social space where students can meet, have something to eat, work on projects or simply spend the night playing on xbox. Most importantly we created skype booths to provide the students with some easy contact with home.

properties.name: Estates & Buildings Departmetn
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Following the installation of artworks in the Fraser Building and the Undercrofts the Estates and Buildings Department requested their own artwork for their new offices. The artwork is currently be installed. Pictures soon!

properties.name: Fraserburgh Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The Archie Foundation is the official charity of the Royal Aberdeen Children\'s Hospital. This fantastic charities aim is \'making the difference\' for children who are patients of the NHS in Grampian and the islands. Nomad have been appointed to produce artworks for Fraserburgh Hospital Accident and Emergency and GMED Department

properties.name: GCU Campus
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc We are delighted to be working on a number of exciting projects at Glasgow Caledonian University. Their enthusiasm and willingness to embrace new ideas make them an ideal client.

properties.name: Glasgow Barrowlands
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Iconic Glasgow landmark and world famous concert venue. Originally built in 1934, bombed then rebuilt in 1960 yet sadly historic Scotland have refused to protect the building and iconic sign.

properties.name: Glasgow City Chambers
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Great glorious Victorian carbuncle featuring Glasgow\'s statue of liberty, another sculpture by James Alexander Ewing.

properties.name: Glasgow Film Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc   The GFT is possibly the only cinema in Glasgow where you can take your cocktails (in a thermos) and a nice wee picnic and watch anything from the latest in French cinema to \'Its a wonderful life\' on Christmas Eve. GFT\'s location close to the art school has resulted in many lectures being held in this unique place (which seems terribly fitting for GSA). The building is also notable, build in 1939, it was originally the Cosmo Cinema, a purpose built art house cinema and the interior has retained its original deco style.

properties.name: Glasgow Film Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc    The GFT is possibly the only cinema in Glasgow where you can take your cocktails (in a thermos) and a nice wee picnic and watch anything from the latest in French cinema to \'Its a wonderful life\' on Christmas Eve. GFT\'s location close to the art school has resulted in many lectures being held in this unique place (which seems terribly fitting for GSA). The building is also notable, build in 1939, it was originally the Cosmo Cinema, a purpose built art house cinema and the interior has retained its original deco style.

properties.name: Glasgow International Airport
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Our second home. We are here almost every month, sometimes up to three times a month.

properties.name: Glasgow School of Art
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc   Charles Rennie Mackintosh masterpiece

properties.name: Glasgow School of Art
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Home of the Mackintosh Building and the magnificent interior design department where some of our team tutor part-time.

properties.name: Glasgow University Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The public have a love/hate relationship with the architecture of the library. We love it. UoG library is a favorite non Nomad library.

properties.name: Govanhill Baths / Calder Street Pool
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc   Govanhill Baths and Wash house was built in 1914 and closed by Glasgow City Council in 2001. A great example of civic architecture at the turn of the century and the building also houses the local Steamie. A campaign to re-open the Baths has been running since it\'s closure in 2001. For more info click on link above.

properties.name: Graduate School
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Another project where we are providing consultation services. This time we are working with Capita (architects) in addition to the University.

properties.name: Greek Thomson
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The magnificent Moray Place

properties.name: Hawthornes
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The Hawthornes hotel, part of UoG and a frequent lunch spot. This is also the site for the prestigious Libris project. Currently an international design competition.

properties.name: Heathrow.  T5
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Heathrow, yet another home from home. T5 is splendid and there is an all time Nomad favorite Waggas where you can even have breakfast. (not done that yet).

properties.name: Hendon
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Lots of classic post WW1 domestic deco architecture in this region

properties.name: Highline Project
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Hopefully a future Nomad Field Trip

properties.name: Homes for the Future
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Master planned by Page Park Architects and coinciding with Glasgow 1999, Year of Architecture (image of Ushida Findlay\'s home for the future)

properties.name: Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The accommodation at RHUL is excellent and a new Hotel for visitors is among the best we have stayed in.

properties.name: Hotels
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Good hotel, reasonably priced and nice staff. Also has an excellent bar and breakfasts.

properties.name: Imperial Station Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Old world charm.

properties.name: Inflate
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc One of our favorite suppliers. Inflate produced the inflatable rooms and umbrellas for us in the Saltire Centre and have made a number of smaller installations for us. Although nearly always met with skepticism inflatable architecture in educational environments provides maximum flexibility and is very robust.

properties.name: Kingston Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The wildly underrated and bizarre Kingston Bridge. An essential for the Glasgow traveler. (photo courtesy of grrrrr;s flickr photostream)

properties.name: Kinning Park Pump House
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Wonderful industrial architecture. Built in 1909 for Glasgow Corporation. D and A Home Morton were the engineers but we cannot find any mention of the architects. Also the site for Vals degree project. (photography courtesy of John R Hume, not sure we should have pinched it but did so in good faith!)

properties.name: Lochaber College
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Learn Direct Scotland commissioned Nomad to produce exemplar designs for learning environments. The main case study was based in Lochaber College in Fort William. We were just happy to spend a day in this location.

properties.name: Loop Evaluation
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad are conducting a post evaluation survey of the Loop at Blackpool and the Fylde College. The results will influence future designs for the college.

properties.name: Luton Airport
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Not our favorite airport from an architectural point of view but is certainly one of the best ways to get into central London without too much drama, Another home from home we are here once a fortnight at least at the moment.

properties.name: MRY Architects
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc MYR Architects. We have recently entered a design competition with this California based architectural firm. Fingers crossed.

properties.name: Middlesex University
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Visited this lovely campus for a meeting, well worth a look.

properties.name: Moira Jane's
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Great food, fantastic staff, lovely atmosphere. Our home from home.

properties.name: Moray Place
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The magnificent Moray Place by Alexander \'Greek\' Thomson.

properties.name: NUI Galway
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The National University of Ireland asked us over for the day in 2007. We met some great people, hopefully provided some useful advice and had a lovely day out-complete with a guided tour of the famous Galway Bay. The James Hardiman Library at NUI is a splendid example of modernist brutalist architecture and is like a glass cube suspended in a concrete frame. Sadly the staff did not like it, but we adored it.

properties.name: Nomad RDC
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Researchers, designers, conceptual thinkers.

properties.name: Nomad Studio
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Our studio, located in the heart of the South Side. The studio is actually an old shop unit in a Greek Thomson building and is surrounded by similar, if slightly grander Greek Thomson architecture.

properties.name: Norwich Market
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc   A market has been located on this site since Saxon times and this is the largest open air market in the country.

properties.name: Page and Park Architects
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Home of our favorite Scottish architects-we worked alongside P/P on the Fraser Building our first major project at Nomad. The picture is the Maggie\'s Highland Cancer Care Centre at Raigmore Hospital in Inverness

properties.name: Queens Park
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Lovely for a wee walk. The small pond is best.

properties.name: Radisson SAS
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The magnificent Radisson SAS hotel by GM+AD Architects.

properties.name: Regent's College
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Regent\'s college, the site of our latest project. We hope to provide the Tate Library with a range of modern learning spaces and infrastructure while retaining the original character of this period building.

properties.name: Rose Street
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The site of our most recent opportunity (hopefully) An organic restaurant and takeaway.

properties.name: Satsuma
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nostalgic Nomad eaterie

properties.name: Scottish Ballet
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Scottish Ballet\'s Glasgow HQ by Malcolm Fraser Architects

properties.name: Scottish Ballet
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc New residence of Scottish Ballet by Malcolm Fraser Architects

properties.name: St Pancras Station
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc St Pancras, home to Eurostar and stop off point in our trips to Regent college. We love the statue of Sir John Betjeman with his shopping bag.

properties.name: Stevenson Building
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc A spectator gallery overlooking the pool in the Sports and Recreation department. The gallery provides students with a social learning space and was a prototype which used many of the products intended for the Fraser Building close by.

properties.name: Stirling University
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  We are delighted to be working on a feasibility study for University of Stirling. This fabulous green park campus is a beautiful place to be working.

properties.name: The Braes High School
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc One of our favorite clients. The Braes High School is a School of ambition and over the years we have designed a number of diverse projects for the school including a playground concept and the dinner hall. Sadly only the library and student common room project have been able to be funded so far.

properties.name: The Church of St Peter Mancroft
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The largest church in Norwich built between 1430 and 1455. The church has Norman foundations and the architecture is largely English Gothic

properties.name: The Design Guide
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc University of Bristol has 12 libraries located in academic building spread across the campus. Nomad have authored a design guide for the libraries which provides the library service and other design professionals with information on the current and future changes in learning and teaching, strategy for the library spaces, specification and an identity for the libraries. The identity employs diagrammatic materials found in first year reading lists of each subject and arranges these black and white diagrams in a graffiti or decorative pattern. This in turn creates an identity which is homogeneous across the service yet is individual to each space.

properties.name: The Design Museum
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc UK mecca of design and site of Nomad annual pilgrimage.

properties.name: The Forum & Millenium Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc     Home of BBC East and the Millennium Library which replaced the old city central library

properties.name: The Fraser Building
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Our first major project and our first major collaboration with Page/Park architects. The Fraser Building, originally titled The Hub is a four floor student services building located in the heart of UoG. The building contains 100% student service which are delivered direct to students or virtually, a GP practice, a bookshop, conferencing rooms and a 420 seat restaurant.

properties.name: The Hidden Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  Scotlands first public garden designed for the 21st century by NVA environmental artists

properties.name: The Huntarian Museum/Mackintosh House
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The Huntarian Museum has recreated the principle interiors of the home of Charles Rennie Mackintosh. It is a fascinating place and gives a real insight into the architects work from the journey of dark-light from bottom floor to first floor and the sheer wealth of details and colours. The staff at the Huntarian have also been very supportive of our artwork for the Undercrofts and Fraser building.

properties.name: The Lighthouse
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Scottish mecca of architecture and of course the Vitra showroom, which we love.

properties.name: The Loop @ Central
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad are currently working on designs for the library at Blackpool & the Fylde College Central Campus. The library is located within a new building by John Macaslin & Partners currently under construction.

properties.name: The Medical Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The Medical Library is enclosed within the Medical Building at UoB. The plan comprised a number of disjointed spaces with a circulation route through the centre. We tied the spaces together with a quieter more shallow circulation route around the perimeter. The original features added a great sense of history to the place and we retained and complemented these as far as possible. Finally we created a range of flexible spaces for different learners and supported these with new service delivery items.

properties.name: The Pakistani Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc The latest studio favorite. The food is amazing and the atmosphere even better.

properties.name: The Saltire Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc One of our favorite pre-Nomad projects where our brave clients allowed us to be as experimental as we wanted. The Saltire Centre was also the first major project where we talked to students in depth.

properties.name: The Tramway
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The Tramway arts centre

properties.name: The Tron Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Photo courtesy of benallison36\'s flickr photostream

properties.name: The Undercrofts
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc An exhibition celebrating the University of Glasgow\'s past and future located in the historic Gilbert Scott building entrance. The work was inspired by the \'walls of intrigue\' artwork we were working on for the Fraser Building at the time. The artwork consists of materials from the University archive and the Huntarian Museum which have been painstakingly collaged together.

properties.name: Tinderbox
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc G12 8TSWe are huge fans of the work of Graven Images who are practically a Glasgow design institution. Tinderbox is among the very best examples of their work.

properties.name: Tolbooth Tower
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc  The old Tolbooth steeple, now a kind of traffic island but originally part of a larger building that housed Glasgow Councils Chambers and Administration. It was built in 1627 and the main section of the building demolished after the first world war. (photo John Lindie Flickr photostream)

properties.name: UL - Glucksman Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad will be working with University of Limerick at the Glucksman Library this summer/autumn generating concepts for the library and re-imagining the learning spaces.

properties.name: University of Bath Library
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc One of very first projects for Nomad. The library is 24 hours access and we lived on site carrying out various observational exercises at different times of day for one week, (including 3am! when the library was surprisingly busy). We noted that all the spaces were the same and there was no opportunity to relax. Many of the students were trying to work together and customising what there was of flexible furniture to suit, in addition students were spending up to 12 hours in the library. We created a new collaborative space on the ground floor for students to work together and used a domestic aesthetic to make students feel more comfortable

properties.name: University of Bradford
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc We created a new student services hub and flexible learning space for University of Bradford. The University is a well known \'ecoversity\' and we were challenged to source many of our products locally and responsibly. We were really happy to find local furniture /product designer, Naughtone (based in Leeds) who we asked to collaborate with Smile plastics who recycle a variety of plastic products. The result was a variation on Naughtone\'s now famous \'Trace Table\'

properties.name: University of East Anglia
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc We carried out a 5 month research led design project exploring the library at UEA. Our research methods ranged from the detailed and exhaustive to quick and sketchy and included staff and student participation. The group we worked with were fantastic and we were able to put together proposals that covered a range of learning space, new infrastructures and research facilities.

properties.name: University of Limerick
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc In June we presented at the Irish National University Librarians Conference at the University of Limerick. The people were lovely and the campus was beautiful and we spent the afternoon exploring. We had been particularly keen to see Wilkinson Eyre\'s Living Bridge (worth the visit alone) and there was also an Anthony Gormley Sculpture spotted titled \'Together and Apart\' We have since been appointed by the University to undertake a study of the Glucksman Library

properties.name: University of Ulster
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc In 2006 we were asked by University of Ulster to stand in for Les Watson as speakers at the IUISC conference. The topic was of course the experimental design of the Saltire Centre. This was our first major speaking engagement and it was a big one, we don\'t mind admitting some nerves. Thanks to Noel and Nigel who looked after us though.

properties.name: Vitra Campus
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Home of our favorite manufacturer Vitra who supply classics from Eames to Pouvre and modern classics from cutting edge designers such as Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec. The site is also a showcase of architecture and includes buildings by Frank Gehry, Zaha Hadid, Nicholas Grimshaw and Tadao Ando

properties.name: Vitra, Basel
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Home of our all time favorite furniture from Eames - Pouvre. The HQ is worth a visit for the architecture alone as it is the second Vitra building designed by Frank Gehry

properties.name: Waggas
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Favorite Nomad eating spot.

properties.name: Waggas (Wagamama)
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc All time Nomad favorite dinner spot.

properties.name: Wills Building
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc Nomad are providing consultation services to the University of Bristol for the refurbishment of the Earth Sciences and Law libraries located in the historic Wills Memorial Building. Our role is to provide guidance on the strategies laid out in the Design Guide. The architect designing the project is award winning Feilden Clegg Bradley Studios

properties.name: tlc @ bedford
properties.description: Posted by Nomadrdc TLC (The Learning Cafe) at Bedford is a new flexible social learning space completed in 2008. The space creates a dedicated group working space with a range of open and closed spaces on the ground floor of the library. It is supporting with state of the art self issue and technology.
